instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Panic (CPU 2 CALLER 0XFFFFF80007964E)
threads.message: I got a macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> that keeps throwing this error. it just keeps rebooting non stop. I already tried reinstalling the os and a new hdd. is this the gpu?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Panic (CPU 2 CALLER 0XFFFFF80007964E)
threads.message: There are about 6 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> models.... More likely bad RAM or a bad RAM slot.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Panic (CPU 2 CALLER 0XFFFFF80007964E)
threads.message: Sorry for not specifying the exact board number. I was able to fix the issue by replacing <CAPACITOR>C9650</CAPACITOR> by a 330uf non tantalum cap. The board number was <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. You may close this post

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Panic (CPU 2 CALLER 0XFFFFF80007964E)
threads.message: <CAPACITOR>C9650</CAPACITOR> will usually not cause a panic this early on boot. Expect other issues!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Panic (CPU 2 CALLER 0XFFFFF80007964E)
threads.message: it's interesting that you say that. the computer is working properly but every time it boots up it says safe boot on the top right corner. could this be due to this? besides that the computer is working properly. I haven't got any kernel panics.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Panic (CPU 2 CALLER 0XFFFFF80007964E)
threads.message: No idea, safe boot can also happen if the left shift is stuck, which can be the keyboard or the shit+CMD+ALT isolation circuit on the board....
